meta.description: NIST Special Publication 800-53 Rev 5 - Security and Privacy Controls for Information Systems - For DEFENSE project

requirements.title: Information Flow Enforcement
requirements.description: Enforce approved authorizations for controlling the flow of information within the system and between connected systems

validation.acceptance_criteria: Network segmentation enforced with security groups allowing only authorized traffic flows

requirements.discussion: Information flow control regulates where information can travel within a system and between systems. This includes network traffic filtering via security groups and NACLs.

requirements.title: Least Privilege
requirements.description: Employ the principle of least privilege, allowing only authorized accesses for users which are necessary to accomplish assigned organizational tasks

validation.acceptance_criteria: Zero IAM policies with Action:* and Resource:* combination; all roles follow least-privilege

requirements.discussion: Organizations employ least privilege for specific duties and systems. The principle of least privilege is applied with the goal of authorized privileges no higher than necessary to accomplish required organizational missions or business functions.

requirements.title: Least Privilege | Authorize Access to Security Functions
requirements.description: Authorize access for individuals and roles to security-relevant information and security functions

validation.acceptance_criteria: Security function access restricted to explicitly authorized individuals with MFA enforcement

requirements.discussion: Security functions include establishing system accounts, configuring access authorizations, setting events to be audited, and setting intrusion detection parameters.

requirements.title: Least Privilege | Non-privileged Access for Nonsecurity Functions
requirements.description: Require that users of system accounts with access to security functions use non-privileged accounts when accessing nonsecurity functions

validation.acceptance_criteria: No containers run with privileged mode; service accounts use least-privilege RBAC

requirements.discussion: Requiring the use of non-privileged accounts when accessing nonsecurity functions limits exposure when operating from within privileged accounts or roles.

requirements.title: Least Privilege | Privileged Accounts
requirements.description: Restrict privileged accounts on the system to designated personnel or roles

validation.acceptance_criteria: Privileged accounts limited to designated security personnel with quarterly access reviews

requirements.discussion: Privileged accounts, including super user accounts, are typically described as system administrator for various types of commercial off-the-shelf operating systems.

requirements.title: Event Logging
requirements.description: Identify the types of events that the system is capable of logging and coordinate event logging with other organizational entities

validation.acceptance_criteria: All systems log security-relevant events with 365-day retention and encryption

requirements.discussion: Event logging is a critical component of system security. Organizations define the types of events to be logged based on the types of threats and the classification of the data.

requirements.title: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting
requirements.description: Review and analyze system audit records for indications of inappropriate or unusual activity

validation.acceptance_criteria: CloudTrail enabled in all regions with log file validation, S3 encryption, and automated analysis

requirements.discussion: Audit record review, analysis, and reporting covers information security- and privacy-related logging performed by organizations, including logging that results from monitoring system and network traffic.

requirements.title: Audit Record Retention
requirements.description: Retain audit records for a time period consistent with records retention policy to provide support for after-the-fact investigations

validation.acceptance_criteria: All audit logs retained for minimum 365 days with archival to S3 Glacier for long-term retention

requirements.discussion: Organizations retain audit records until it is determined that the records are no longer needed for administrative, legal, audit, or other operational purposes.

requirements.title: System Backup
requirements.description: Conduct backups of user-level and system-level information contained in the system

validation.acceptance_criteria: All critical systems have automated backups with 365-day retention and quarterly restoration testing

requirements.discussion: System-level information includes system-state information, operating system software, middleware, application software, and licenses.

requirements.title: System Backup | Testing for Reliability and Integrity
requirements.description: Test backup information to verify media reliability and information integrity

validation.acceptance_criteria: Quarterly restoration tests documented with success criteria and lessons learned

requirements.discussion: Testing backup information verifies the integrity of backup files and the reliability of backup media. Organizations can satisfy this control by ensuring backups are tested as part of training exercises or drills.

requirements.title: System Recovery and Reconstitution
requirements.description: Provide for the recovery and reconstitution of the system to a known state within organization-defined time periods

validation.acceptance_criteria: RTO < 4 hours, RPO < 1 hour for critical systems with documented DR procedures

requirements.discussion: Recovery and reconstitution to a known state means that all system parameters are restored to previous configurations and system documentation is current and available.

requirements.title: Vulnerability Monitoring and Scanning
requirements.description: Monitor and scan for vulnerabilities in the system and hosted applications and when new vulnerabilities potentially affecting the system are identified

validation.acceptance_criteria: Vulnerability scans every 30 days minimum; HIGH/CRITICAL findings remediated within 30 days

requirements.discussion: Security categorization of information and systems guides the frequency and comprehensiveness of vulnerability monitoring. Organizations determine the required vulnerability monitoring for system components, ensuring sufficient coverage occurs.

requirements.title: Boundary Protection
requirements.description: Monitor and control communications at the external managed interfaces to the system and at key internal managed interfaces within the system

validation.acceptance_criteria: Network boundaries defined and enforced with security groups, NACLs, and VPC peering controls

requirements.discussion: Managed interfaces include gateways, routers, firewalls, guards, network-based malicious code analysis, virtualization systems, or encrypted tunnels implemented within a security architecture.

requirements.title: Boundary Protection | Deny by Default - Allow by Exception
requirements.description: Deny network communications traffic by default and allow network communications traffic by exception

validation.acceptance_criteria: All security groups configured with explicit allow rules; default deny policy enforced

requirements.discussion: Denying by default and allowing by exception prevents unauthorized connections. This applies to inbound and outbound network communications traffic.

requirements.title: Cryptographic Protection
requirements.description: Implement FIPS-validated cryptography for storing and transmitting information

validation.acceptance_criteria: 100% of data encrypted with FIPS 140-2 validated cryptographic modules (AES-256-GCM)

requirements.discussion: Cryptographic standards include FIPS-validated cryptography and NSA-approved cryptography. Organizations that rely on cryptographic mechanisms for protecting information establish specific management controls for cryptographic protocols.

requirements.title: Protection of Information at Rest
requirements.description: Protect the confidentiality and integrity of information at rest

validation.acceptance_criteria: 100% of data at rest encrypted with KMS CMKs and automatic key rotation enabled

requirements.discussion: Information at rest refers to the state of information when it is not in process or in transit and is located on storage devices as specific components of systems.

requirements.title: Protection of Information at Rest | Cryptographic Protection
requirements.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure and modification of information at rest

validation.acceptance_criteria: All KMS keys have automatic rotation, CloudTrail logging, and restricted access policies

requirements.discussion: The selection of cryptographic mechanisms is based on the need to protect the confidentiality and integrity of organizational information. The strength of mechanism is commensurate with the security category or classification of the information.

requirements.title: Flaw Remediation
requirements.description: Identify, report, and correct system flaws including installation of security-relevant software and firmware updates

validation.acceptance_criteria: CRITICAL vulnerabilities remediated within 15 days; HIGH within 30 days; MEDIUM within 90 days

requirements.discussion: Organizations identify systems affected by announced software and firmware flaws including potential vulnerabilities resulting from those flaws and report this information to designated organizational personnel with information security and privacy responsibilities.

requirements.title: Flaw Remediation | Automated Flaw Remediation Status
requirements.description: Determine if system components have applicable security-relevant software and firmware updates installed using automated mechanisms

validation.acceptance_criteria: Automated vulnerability tracking dashboard showing real-time remediation status for all systems

requirements.discussion: Automated mechanisms can track and determine the status of known flaws for system components. This capability is particularly important with the increasing number and frequency of software and firmware updates.

requirements.title: Least Functionality
requirements.description: Configure the system to provide only mission-essential capabilities and prohibit or restrict the use of specified functions, ports, protocols, and/or services

validation.acceptance_criteria: Containers run with read-only root filesystem, drop all capabilities except required, and use non-root users

requirements.discussion: Providing only mission-essential capabilities removes unnecessary functions that can be exploited by adversaries. Restricting functions, ports, protocols, and services can be achieved through policy or technical means.
